# Using for loops to determine # zeros in a numerical vector
```{r}
Vector <- c(0,0,1,1,0,1,0,1,1,1)
head(Vector)
Vec0<-vector(mode="logical")
for (i in 1:length(Vector)) {
  if (Vector[i] == 0) {
    Vec0[i] <- 1 
     }
  else {
    Vec0[i]<- 0
  }
}
  sum(Vec0)

```

# Using subsetting rather than for loops
```{r}
Vector <- c(0,0,1,1,0,1,0,1,1,1)

length((Vec0) <= subset(Vector, Vector == 0))
```

```{r}
Vector <- c(2,3,4)
print(Vector)
VecDiff <- as.numeric(dist(Vector))
print(VecDiff)
max(VecDiff,na.rm=TRUE)

pairs <- expand.grid(Vector,Vector)
print(pairs)
Matrix <- matrix()

for (i in 1:pairs[,1]){
  for (j in 1:pairs[,2]){
Matrix[i,j] <- (i-j)
print(Matrix)

    
  }
}


```
